DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Organ or Space Surgical Site Infection Characteristic Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The characteristics that identify an organ space surgical site infection that occurs within 30 days after a procedure and appears to be related to the operation.  The infection can involve any part of the anatomy (for example, organs or spaces), other than the incision, which was opened or manipulated during an operation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Organ or Space Surgical Site Infection Characteristic
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any part of the anatomy, other than the incision, which was opened or manipulated during an operation._An infection that occurs at a surgical site within 30 days after an operation._Characteristics; distinguishing qualities of a person, object, or substance.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Surgical Organ or Space SSI Characteristic Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.value: Purulent drainage from a drain that is placed through a stab wound into the organ/space
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Surgical Organ or Space Purulent Discharge

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Surgical Organ or Space Purulent Discharge
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any part of the anatomy, other than the incision, which was opened or manipulated during an operation.: Consisting of or containing pus; associated with the formation of or caused by pus.

Concepts.definition: Any part of the anatomy, other than the incision, which was opened or manipulated during an operation.
Pus-containing fluid that is draining from an orifice or wound.

PermissibleValues.value: Diagnosis of an organ/space SSI by a surgeon or attending physician
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Surgical Organ or Space Surgical Site Infection Surgeon Diagnosis

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Surgical Organ or Space Surgical Site Infection Surgeon Diagnosis
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any part of the anatomy, other than the incision, which was opened or manipulated during an operation.: An infection that occurs at a surgical site within 30 days after an operation.: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation.: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: Any part of the anatomy, other than the incision, which was opened or manipulated during an operation.
An infection that occurs at a surgical site within 30 days after an operation.
A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation that involves gaining access to the patient's body by incisional access.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

PermissibleValues.value: An abscess or other evidence of infection involving the organ/space that is found on direct examination, during reoperation, or by histopathologic  or radiologic examination
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: An abscess or other evidence of infection involving the organ/space that is found on direct examination, during reoperation, or by histopathologic  or radiologic examination

ValueMeaning.preferredName: An abscess or other evidence of infection involving the organ/space that is found on direct examination, during reoperation, or by histopathologic  or radiologic examination
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An abscess or other evidence of infection involving the organ/space that is found on direct examination, during reoperation, or by histopathologic  or radiologic examination

PermissibleValues.value: Organisms isolated from an aseptically obtained culture of fluid or tissue in the organ/space
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Surgical Organ or Space Sterile Cell Culture Organism

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Surgical Organ or Space Sterile Cell Culture Organism
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any part of the anatomy, other than the incision, which was opened or manipulated during an operation.: Devoid of living organisms.: General term referring to the maintenance of cell strains or lines in the laboratory.: A living thing, such as an animal, a plant, a bacterium, or a fungus.

Concepts.definition: Any part of the anatomy, other than the incision, which was opened or manipulated during an operation.
General term referring to the maintenance of cell strains or lines in the laboratory.
